message.content:
1. There were forty-two overweight premenopausal women involved in the study.
2. All the women had PCOS (Polycystic Ovary Syndrome).
3. None of the women had clinical depression.
4. The women were randomized into two groups.
5. One group was given 20mg of escitalopram per day.
6. The number of women in the escitalopram group was 21.
7. The other group was given a placebo.
8. The number of women in the placebo group was 21.
9. The duration of the study was 12 weeks.
10. The escitalopram given was an SSRI (Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitor).

messages.content:
Statement: Forty-two overweight premenopausal women with PCOS and no clinical depression were randomized to 12-week SSRI (20 mg escitalopram/day, n = 21) or placebo (n = 21).

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
